Yeah W is a cool thing, but every ekko will just walk in lane, hard shove all days, get hextech revolver and all in you on sight and are clueless if it doesn't work.

I've played agains't many ekko challenger to Diamond 2 and it's almost like W does not exist and R is only a escape tool (Way too predictable). I'd like to see smart use of W and R but it feel like it isn't necessary as much as Zed doesn't need to land Q in his ult combo.

The difference between most Assassins and Ekko is that he really doesnt have a you are dead now button. it is much easier to Assassinate with Leblanc, Zed, Ahri, and others than it is with Ekko unless he is really far ahead. if he was so easy everyone would play him and he would have a high WR but he doesnt. you have to make smart choices with Ekko going in and out of battle. While he doesnt have an I kill you now button he is more adaptable then most assassins and isnt 1 directional like others so less predicable as he can assist the team better in team fights with Proper W placements, peel, or even assist in retreats.

i wasnt exactly saying that ekko is easy, i was saying ahri is easier than ekko. but ekko isnt the most difficult of assassins either.
I was reading it as these 4 are hard to kill since they so mobile
Most of her kit is point & click. She only has chain and isn't too much reliant on landing it.

While i can see most of your points aside the {{champion:103}} being skillful (im guessing that was just a joke) 

I agree with the point of duskblade being most of the cause of it, but i dont believe its whole reason.
For example if you removed duskblade then just about every ad assassin is basically weak. The reason they gave a strong braindead item like dusk is because most ad assassins have alot more counterplay than ap assassins (not all just most) for example while most ap assassins can pop enemies extremely quickly they also dont have much outplay potential which makes them viable whether they are braindead or not, while ad assassins have alot more outplay potential (whether its because their burst isnt as fast because they can aa for dmg or because their burst is extremely telegraphed)

Zed without dusk is relatively weak because his ult is countered by stopwatch or hourglass and without dusk he doesnt quite have the dmg to pop people in one combo

Talon without dusk isnt able to pop people and his burst is at some points easily telegraphed

The rest i assume you can figure out on your own.

My point is that there is too much outplay potential in champs now, so in order to make assassins viable they need to give them the ability to assassinate.
I dont think ad assassins are a problem right now, if anything its ap assassins that need a nerf. If you look at the most played champs from plat+ the first assassin that appears is Ahri at number 23 and there are 4 more ap assassins after until the first ad assassin which is zed at 43. 

I do wish there was a way for them to fix the braindead part about assassins because i honestly loved assassins being skillful to play. But i think if they remove it then ad assassins will be in a very bad spot.

lol I mainly mean her laning phase, but even end game you can wait to engage on a team when she lands her charm. Easy escape after a mistake with 3 dashes or easy way to chase down a champion.
